abstract: While a vast system of new rules governing bank behavior has arisen, some regulators wonder if enough has been done, and some analysts say the largest banks may shrink.
snippet: While a vast system of new rules governing bank behavior has arisen, some regulators wonder if enough has been done, and some analysts say the largest banks may shrink.
lead_paragraph: Governments around the world have built over the last few years a vast new system of rules that would allow banking giants to fail and shield taxpayers from bailouts.

headline.main: New Doubts About ‘Too Big to Fail’ Banks Rattle Foundation of Regulations
headline.print_headline: New Tremors in High Finance Rattle Foundation of Postcrisis Regulations

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act (2010)
